    • Method Detail

      • initialize

        public void initialize()
        Configures UI elements.

      • processSpriteModeSwitch

        public void processSpriteModeSwitch()
        One of the methods responsible for modifying element positions depending on using animated sprites or not. Using animated sprites requires modifying sizes of some elements.
        See Also:
        BattleController.processSpriteModeSwitch(), SummaryController.processSpriteModeSwitch()

      • setAddData

        public void setAddData(Pokemon pokemon,
                       java.util.List<Pokemon> playerParty,
                       java.util.List<Pokemon> enemyParty,
                       TeamBuilderController previousController,
                       javafx.scene.layout.Pane pane)
        Sets data related to displaying a Pokémon's data.Also gathers data about the current player and enemy teams. Add mode allows to add a Pokémon to one of the parties. Edit mode allows to edit one of the already existing party Pokémon.
        Parameters:
        pokemon - Pokémon that is to be displayed
        playerParty - current player party
        enemyParty - current enemy party
        previousController - controller connected to the previous screen
        pane - pane connected to the previous screen

      • enterAddMode

        public void enterAddMode()
        Sets the UI into add mode.
        See Also:
        setAddData(Pokemon, List, List, TeamBuilderController, Pane)

      • enterEditMode

        public void enterEditMode(boolean ally,
                          int index)
        Sets the UI into edit mode.
        Parameters:
        ally - true if the currently edited Pokémon belongs to ally party, false otherwise
        index - index in the party of the currently edited Pokémon

      • updatePokemonMoveList

        private void updatePokemonMoveList()
        Updates the current Pokémon's move list with the data entered into the UI.

      • returnToBuilder

        public void returnToBuilder()
        Returns to the Team Builder screen.

      • addPlayerPokemon

        public void addPlayerPokemon()
        Adds the currently displayed Pokémon into the player party. If in edit mode, first deletes the previous version of the Pokémon and inserts the updated version.

      • addEnemyPokemon

        public void addEnemyPokemon()
        Adds the currently displayed Pokémon into the enemy party. If in edit mode, first deletes the previous version of the Pokémon and inserts the updated version.

      • refreshStats

        private void refreshStats()
        Refreshes the displayed statistics to reflect the changes that have occurred.

      • setPokemonTypes

        private void setPokemonTypes()
        Sets up Pokémon type information.

      • setNatureChoiceBox

        private void setNatureChoiceBox()
        Sets up the ChoiceBox object with the list of available natures, as well as sets a value listener that changes the Pokémon's nature when a change in value is detected.

      • refreshPokemonStatistics

        private void refreshPokemonStatistics()
        Refreshes the displayed Pokémon's statistics.

      • isMoveDuplicate

        private boolean isMoveDuplicate(int index,
                                boolean startFromIndex,
                                @Nullable
                                boolean[] skip)
        Checks if the move in the specified index is a duplicate of another.
        Parameters:
        index - index of the move
        startFromIndex - if true starts searching for a duplicate from the index value, otherwise searches from the beginning
        skip - array that specifies which indexes should be skipped during search, if null then the search is performed normally
        Returns:
        true if a duplicate move was found, false otherwise

      • checkIfMoveListHasDuplicate

        private boolean checkIfMoveListHasDuplicate()
        Checks if the current move list has duplicates.
        Returns:
        true if duplicates founds, otherwise returns false

      • setMoveBoxFlagDuplicate

        private void setMoveBoxFlagDuplicate(javafx.scene.control.Label moveOkLabel,
                                     javafx.scene.control.Button moveInfoButton)
        Sets the specified label to display a message about the move being a duplicate.
        Parameters:
        moveOkLabel - label to be modified
        moveInfoButton - button that is situated near the label

      • setMoveBoxFlagOk

        private void setMoveBoxFlagOk(javafx.scene.control.Label moveOkLabel,
                              javafx.scene.control.Button moveInfoButton,
                              java.lang.String moveFieldText)
        Sets the specified label to display a message about the move being accepted as valid.
        Parameters:
        moveOkLabel - label to be modified
        moveInfoButton - button that is situated near the label
        moveFieldText - text currently present in the move field

      • setMoveBoxNotFound

        private void setMoveBoxNotFound(javafx.scene.control.Label moveOkLabel,
                                javafx.scene.control.Button moveInfoButton)
        Sets the specified label to display a message about the move not being found.
        Parameters:
        moveOkLabel - label to be modified
        moveInfoButton - button that is situated near the label

      • refreshMoveTags

        private void refreshMoveTags()
        Refreshes all the labels situated near the move entry fields.

      • setStatisticsListeners

        public void setStatisticsListeners()
        Sets up logical listeners related to fields present in the UI. This method specifies the behavior of the UI depending on the data entered by user.

      • prepareMoveInfo

        private void prepareMoveInfo(MoveTemplate move)
        Prepares move info to be displayed to the player.
        Parameters:
        move - move template of the selected move

      • checkMovesOk

        private boolean checkMovesOk()
        Checks if a Pokémon can be created with the entered moves.
        Returns:
        true if all entered moves are valid, false otherwise

      • checkOkPlayer

        private boolean checkOkPlayer()
        Checks if Pokémon can be added to the player's party.
        Returns:
        true if it can be added, false otherwise

      • checkEnemyOk

        private boolean checkEnemyOk()
        Checks if Pokémon can be added to the player's party.
        Returns:
        true if it can be added, false otherwise

      • setPokemonMoves

        private void setPokemonMoves()
        Reads moves known by Pokémon to be displayed and shows them in the move list field.
